Description: Textile fragment; large ragged panel of linen, medium-coarse quality, undyed, now buff-coloured with grey-brown oily stains. Very worn and ragged but no visible repairs. At one side, a plain selvedge with characteristic wear. Across one end, a whipped hem, preceded at 1cm in by a triple self-band. Upper edge cut or torn. Second side ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.22 ends per 10mm and weft c.8 picks per 10mm. There is possibly a warp fringe hidden in the whipped hem.
Curator's comments: Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1995] Possibly from a tunic, although there are no signs of sewing on the selvedge.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville (by inference)
Acquisition notes: EA 76002-76005 were found together with two other textiles (Unregistered 1097-8) in a paper bundle, unlabelled but associated with other bundles labelled 'Dr Granville'. Considered to come from A B Granville, and probably to be part of the wrappings of the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by Granville in 1821.
